medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Hypercalcemia was first detected at age 2 years. The patient has experienced episodes of abdominal pain and fever from age 4 months and had several hospitalizations. At the time of referral, he complained of constipation and recurrent abdominal pain.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Episodes of abdominal pain and fever, hospitalization for acute appendicitis, treated conservatively. Hypercalcemia with serum calcium levels at various ages indicated persistent elevated levels.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's parents were heterozygous for the Q459R mutation. Other family members exhibited varied genotypes and biochemical parameters.
medical_history.social_history: Born to first-cousin Arab-Bedouin parents. Not specified.
